Author: Seko#7408
Content:
I talked to JL777 in #talk-other-topics  about the future of games on blockchain.

I firmly believe that games will work on the blockchain as well.  Of course we need funding and developers.

There are really good games on NEO and Ethereum already.  We on Komodo have the big advantage of scaling already now.

An example:

I'm a big football (soccer) fan, that's why this example. 
 
A simple football game.  A penalty shootout.  A tournament and everyone pays a small stake in the pool.  The winner of the tournament gets the pool at the end minus small fees.

I was already successful with Flash and HTML5 games.  With game sites and affiliates.  But the blockchain opens new doors for us.

The market is so big!

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Casino games, but also RPG games, everything is possible.  These games already exist, some are very complex.  But even simple games work.  Just like Flashgames a few years ago and applications today.

Author: Seko#7408
Content:
There was once a simple penalty shootout that many fans from Europe played for their club.  It was very simple, but it still worked. 

The name of the game was ‚Äûplay for your club‚Äú.
 
The operator made money with Affiliate.

On the Blockchain you can earn money with fees.  And as an incentive for the game there are rewards, for example if you win.

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: Hello everybody just for you to know we are planning to build www.pixdum.com using the Komodo Platform. It will be a Decentrlized Gaming Platform.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: good to hear!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just ask if you need help with designing CC

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: We were going to use previously other platform but Komodo seems to fit perfectly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: good to hear. doing a bit of an airdrop to KMD holders can also jumpstart your userbase

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: Thanks James will for sure

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not a requirement, but people love airdrops

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: Yes that is the idea

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a simple command line dice game is surprisingly popular. a well designed and fun to play game that is monetized via crypto should be quite the hit as long as it can maintain realtime performance

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: We were going to use Elastos but the Komodo community is better and the technology we are looking for is here.

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: Thanks James we will be here getting ideas.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there was a long discussion on making the dice entropy cheat proof, even under reorg

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and if you can determine game outcomes from 2 hashes, it is pretty solid and 512bits should be enough entropy for most game transitions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the best part is that it can have realtime (a few seconds) response

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and of course txfees in your coin

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: We can make that game the first one on PIXDUM

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: As you can see our ideas is for a Decentralized Gaming Platform, where all the games share the same coin

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: So we can trade inside of the game with other Komodo assetchains

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: And buy non-fungible assets

Author: Ignacio Figueroa (FIG)#4221
Content: Like weapons, powers, characters, and so on

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems you will be using assets CC for tokens, oracles CC to get offchain data onchain, dice CC for RNG

Content: It will be like the REAL PLAYER ONE movie on Blockchain
